availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry T. Ligon (Hopkins County, Ky, day laborer and prvt in 17th Ky Cav)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, day laborer and soldier. Hopkins County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary A. Ligon. Father of Sarah V. Ligon and Mary E. Ligon. Day laborer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1860. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1864. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from December 3, 1864, to June 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 729.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0140.
